initial_question.title: npm ERR! code ERR_INVALID_PROTOCOL on Safari browser only
initial_question.body:
### Describe the bug

When running `npm run dev`, there is an error with the dev server that is only observer on Safari browser:
```
npm ERR! code ERR_INVALID_PROTOCOL
npm ERR! Protocol "https:" not supported. Expected "http:"

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in: /home/.npm/_logs/2024-11-19T07_40_58_889Z-debug-0.log
```

### Link to the Bolt URL that caused the error

N/A

### Steps to reproduce

Using Safari:
1. Start a NextJS project
2. Try to start the dev server with `nom run dev`

### Expected behavior

The development server should start after installing the package dependencies.

### Screen Recording / Screenshot

_No response_

### Platform

- OS: macOS
- Browser: Safari
- Version: 18.2


### Additional context

This issue has only been observer with the Safari browser.

satisfaction_conditions: Development environment must be accessed through a WebContainers-compatible browser
User must be able to access the development server without protocol-related errors
User must be clearly informed of browser compatibility requirements
